title: Moon Jae-in
summary: Moon Jae-in[lower-alpha 1] (Korean: 문재인; Hanja: 文在寅; Korean pronunciation: [mun.dʑɛ.in];[lower-alpha 2] born January 24, 1953) is a South Korean politician and lawyer who is the 12th and current president of South Korea since 2017.[2][3][4][5] He previously served as senior secretary for civil affairs as well as chief of staff to Roh Moo-hyun,[6] member of the 19th National Assembly, and leader of the Democratic Party of Korea.
